subject: Re: [junit] Limitation on Home Installation of Junit
msgSnippet: Thanks. I tried the setenv command from run , but come to think of it I was already in the GUI environment, and that command only works in DOS. - al ... From:
messageBody:
Thanks. I tried the setenv command from 'run', but come to think of it I was
already in the GUI environment, and that command only works in DOS.

- al
-----Original Message-----
From: Vladimir Bossicard vladimir+AEA-bossicard.com
To: junit+AEA-yahoogroups.com junit+AEA-yahoogroups.com
Date: Wednesday, October 03, 2001 4:55 PM
Subject: Re: +AFs-junit+AF0- Limitation on Home Installation of Junit


+AD4APg- I'd like to use Junit at home on my WIN95 machine, but
+AD4APg- I have to rely on the /ext folder because I can't set a CLASSPATH in that
+AD4APg- environment.

- edit the autoexec.bat file (c:+AFw-autoexec.bat)
- setenv CLASSPATH+AD0-c:+AFw-progra+AH4-1+AFw-junit+AFw-junit.jar (or 'set' I don't remember)
- save the file

the 'classpath' is simply an environment variable.

What I used to have in my autoexec.bat:

setenv JDK+AD0AWw-...+AF0AXA-jdk1.2
setenv JUNIT+AD0AWw-...+AF0AXA-junit
setenv PROJECT+AF8-X+AD0AWw-...+AF0AXA-ProjectX
setenv CLASSPATH+AD0AJQ-JDK+ACUAXA-bin+ADsAJQ-JUNIT+ACUAXA-junit.jar+ADsAJQ-PROJECT+AF8-X+ACUAXA-build

-Vladimir
